title: How to apply the concept of equivalent games in the Sprague-Grundy theorem (game theory, combinatorial game theory, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, the applications are quite evident, I think. The theorem says loosely that any impartial game under normal play can be equated to a one-heap game of Nim. You apply it by showing your game is impartial and uses normal play. Because Nim’s strategy is solved, your game is now solved as well, and you can obtain the exact equivalence with iterated use of the MEX (minimum excluded ordinal) function.
